meanings: [명사] surrender, (formal) submission, (formal) capitulation, [동사] surrender (to), (formal) capitulate (to), submit (to), yield (to), give in (to)

examples.korean: The town capitulated after a three-week siege. 발음듣기 그 소도시는 3주간의 포위 공격 후 항복했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The town capitulated after a three-week siege. 발음

examples.korean: The rebel soldiers were forced to surrender. 발음듣기 반란군들은 어쩔 수 없이 항복해야 했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The rebel soldiers were forced to surrender. 발음

examples.korean: The rebels were forced to give in. 발음듣기 반군들은 할 수 없이 항복해야 했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The rebels were forced to give in. 발음

examples.korean: They demanded (an) unconditional surrender. 발음듣기 그들은 무조건 항복을 요구했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
They surrendered without putting up much of a fight. 발음듣기 그들은 별로 투지를 보이지 않고 항복했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: They surrendered without putting up much of a fight. 발음
